Package logic.piece

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.piece.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Chick, Elephant, Giraffe, Lion, Rooster
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a piece on the game board or in a player's hand. Contains the piece's position, player, and movable directions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Piece.Move
      Enum representing possible move directions of a piece.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        protected Piece​(Piece.Move[] moveDirections,
                boolean player2,
                Game.Coord position,
                boolean promotable,
                char representation,
                int id)
        Constructor for the Piece class with id specified.
        Parameters:
        moveDirections - An array of the directions the piece can move.
        player2 - A boolean that is true if the piece belongs to player 2.
        position - A Coord object containing the piece's coordinate on the board, or null if in hand.
        promotable - A boolean representing if the piece has a special action upon reaching the last row.
        representation - A character representing the piece.
        id - An ID which is unique for each piece, so that multiple objects can represent the same piece.

      • Piece

        protected Piece​(Piece.Move[] moveDirections,
                boolean player2,
                Game.Coord position,
                boolean promotable,
                char representation)
        Constructor for the Piece class with auto-id.
        Parameters:
        moveDirections - An array of the directions the piece can move.
        player2 - A boolean that is true if the piece belongs to player 2.
        position - A Coord object containing the piece's coordinate on the board, or null if in hand.
        promotable - A boolean representing if the piece has a special action upon reaching the last row.
        representation - A character representing the piece.

      • getCopy

        public Piece getCopy​(Game game)
        Gets a full copy of the piece using the getCopiedInstance method then setting common values.
        Parameters:
        game - The game the new piece should belong to.
        Returns:
        The copied piece.

      • reverseDirection

        private void reverseDirection()
        Inverts the move directions of the piece (i.e. change player).

      • getPosition

        public Game.Coord getPosition()
        Getter for piece position.
        Returns:
        Coord object containing piece position.

      • isPromotable

        public boolean isPromotable()
        Getter for promotable.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if piece can be promoted.

      • checkMoveDirection

        public boolean checkMoveDirection​(Piece.Move move)
        Checks if the specified move is one the piece can make (solely on directions the piece can move).
        Parameters:
        move - The move to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if move is possible.

      • moved

        public Piece moved​(Game.Coord newPosition)
        Called when the piece is moved.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - The position the piece has been moved to.
        Returns:
        The piece to place in the new position (can be different in case of promotion).

      • promoted

        public Piece promoted()
        Called if the piece is promoted by moving beyond the last row.
        Returns:
        The promoted piece, e.g. a rooster.

      • captured

        public Piece captured()
        Called when the piece is captured.
        Returns:
        The captured piece, belonging to the other player. May be different object in case of rooster.

      • placed

        public Piece placed​(Game.Coord position)
        Called when the piece is placed on the board.
        Parameters:
        position - The position the piece has been placed.
        Returns:
        The placed piece object.

      • setPlayer

        private void setPlayer​(boolean player2)
        Sets the player the piece belongs to and, if different, flips move directions.
        Parameters:
        player2 - The new player2 boolean value.

      • isPlayer2

        public boolean isPlayer2()
        Getter for player2.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if piece belongs to player 2.

      • isLastRow

        public boolean isLastRow​(Game.Coord position)
        Returns true if the specified coordinate is in the last row for the piece.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if in the last row.

      • isPromotionRow

        public boolean isPromotionRow​(Game.Coord position)
        Returns true if the specified coordinate is one row off the board past the last row.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if just past the last row.

      • canMoveTo

        public boolean canMoveTo​(Game.Coord newPosition)
        Returns true if the piece could move to a certain coordinate. (doesn't take into account being off board or occupied)
        Parameters:
        newPosition - The position to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if move is possible.

      • getMove

        public Piece.Move getMove​(Game.Coord newPosition)
        Gets a move enum value for specified coordinate.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - The coordinate to get the move to.
        Returns:
        The Move enum value.

      • canCapture

        public boolean canCapture​(Piece piece)
        Returns true if the specified piece can be captured by this piece.
        Parameters:
        piece - The piece to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean; true if piece can be taken.

        public int getValue()
        Calculates the value of the piece for use in static board state analysis for the AI.
        Returns:
        The value of the piece.

        Checks if two pieces are equal (have same ID).
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The piece to compare to.
        Returns:

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Used by hash sets and maps to improve efficiency. Should be unique as possible and in this case is unique.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        An as unique as possible integer value representing the piece.
